result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwan Latrell Roaf

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwan Latrell Roaf appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court on behalf of Attorney Colin McGinn for Dwan Latrell Roaf.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Attorney McGinn in trial on another matter.  Attorney Romenesko requests another status conference.  State informs the court that discovery and an offer has been sent.  Court scheduled another status conference.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 09-26-2022

Defendant Dwan Latrell Roaf in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF4725. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Officer B. Olig. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dwan Latrell Roaf in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dwan Latrell Roaf in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Dwan Latrell Roaf in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dwan Latrell Roaf appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
